content.title: Carotid and Vertebral Fibromuscular Dysplasia
content.definition: Fibromuscular dysplasia affecting the cervical internal carotid and vertebral arteries, causing arterial stenosis, aneurysm, and dissection with risk of stroke and TIA.

clinical_features.carotid: Mid to distal cervical ICA (C1-C2 level typical)

clinical_features.tia_stroke: Cerebrovascular events from embolism or dissection

concepts.definition: Complications and associations of cervical FMD.

clinical_features.multifocal: Often have renal or iliac FMD also

clinical_features.aneurysm: Treat intracranial aneurysms per neurosurgical standards

clinical_features.natural_history: Generally benign if no dissection or stroke
